page.title: 12INTERVIEW WITH WILSONS (3)
page.content: Before the war,{Sabden}was a self sufficient village.Everyone's needs were catered for by corner shops which were situation at the end three or every street had three or even four shops on then.Motor cars were not in evidence much,therefore people relied for their goods on the local shop. These{individed bakers,cloggers, {butchers,tailors,general grocery shops and a{co-op. Public transport first started in {Sabden }around{1925}although there was no bus from{Padiham.}People who worked in the mills in{Sabden }who lived in {Padiham }had to set off walking at{5am to start work at{6am.}Then they had to walk back after work at{5pm.Mrs Wilson started working part time in the mills at the age of thirteen,going full time at fourteen.{JULIA PRENDERGAST.
